product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Remote Employees: This is not a Plug and Play Monitor- Trip to Lowes in your Future
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2023
options: Style: 24" 75Hz Blue Light Shift | Pattern: Monitor
text: I have never heard of this brand (not a technology person), so this was my first and likely last purchase from this company.  This monitor was delivered today and I was hoping for a Plug and Play monitor.  Being a remote employee also means I am a self supporting IT Department for my needs.  I read the simple directions and tried to attach the base mount to the monitor with no luck.  Either the screws are not long enough or the base on the monitor was not installed properly.  Either way, it is not being put together as originally designed.  I was already headed to Lowes today, so I will buy longer screws and it should mount properly vs. sending it back and waiting a couple more days for a new monitor to arrive.I did plug it in to make sure the monitor itself did work.  So far so good on it actually functioning properly.Note to self and all other remote employees that now find themselves as self supporting IT people.  Screw accounting and saving your company a few dollars.  They save thousands of dollars no longer having to support you.  Buy name brand technology products and save yourself the hassle with the install and possible having to return it.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Be careful with this monitor and this company -  lasted 2 months. Repair service dubious
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2022
text: Bought 2 of these monitors in April. One started acting up end of May. Too late to return so called Amazon who put me in touch with Sceptre. First call it's like the tech support guy didn't believe me. Told me I had to try it with different cables and on different computers. Did that and got back to them, questions again about did I do this and that. Convinced him I had so sent to web site to fill out an RMA request that needed to be sent in along with the pictures I took of the monitor. Told me the RMA would take 3 to 4 days to get processed and approved. Then have to ship it back on our dime and it would take about 3 weeks to fix it. In the mean time my boss has to use some other monitor.Most companies I deal with replace defective equipment and send a return shipping label for the old part. If you don't ship it back you get charged for it. But this company thinks it's OK to make you return their defective product on your dime and leave you without equipment for a month while they decide if they will fix it.Well they finally decided it was the monitor and not the PC or cables and had me send it in to be repaired. They did send me a box to return it in and did pay for shipping both ways. However after several weeks and getting the monitor back,I put is on a brand new PC and tried it with both a VGA cable and an HDMI cable and it is doing the same thing I sent it in for. When windows puts the monitor to sleep, when it powers back up it is unusable as the picture shows.Right now waiting to see what they are going to do.Got an email this morning asking me to try a few things. It still isn't right. Some companies don't know when to cut their losses. They have probably spent more on shipping, repairs and time then it's worth not to mention customer satisfaction and goodwill.

title: Kind of confusing to find the picture options but overall a good value monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 6, 2020
text: My far more expensive Dell monitor suddenly bit the dust out of nowhere and I didn't have a protection plan (lesson learned). I ordered this because this was about as much as I could afford without going really tiny or lower than 1080p. Once I figured out how to work the menu controls and adjusted the picture to my preferences, it's definitely a good monitor for the price. At first it felt washed out compared to my Dell monitor, but that one had a shiny screen as compared to this one's matte screen, and was also a $300 monitor that I got open box, so of course the picture quality was better. Once I got used to it, it looks totally fine and I don't have refresh rate problems (though I don't play any heavily frame-reliant games, mostly just Dead by Daylight and simple indie games). The mounting system was different than what the instructions showed, but I figured it out. It is a little wobbly but I don't see why that's a problem if you're not moving it around constantly; it stays stable enough for me.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Be Careful When Mounting to Monitor Arms
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 29, 2021
text: I have this as a third monitor for my music workstation and it works great.Recently I decided to mount it to a monitor arm and found that the mounting plate in the arm did not sit flush with the back of the monitor. Not sure if this is a problem with the plate or the design of the monitor. When the mounting screws were tightened I noticed that the HDMI cables would no longer connect snugly. Tightening the screws had raised the panel on the monitor that surrounded the input connectors. Loosening the screws fixed the problem but I've installed many arms over the years and it's the first time I've ever run into an issue like this.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Pretty good for the money

text: For everyone who wants to know, no this is not a full out gaming monitor. No it is not a tv, although technically you could use it like one. But I will say it works pretty good for the money. The picture is smooth and the resolution is pretty nice for a $100 monitor. But this isn't going to be anything like a 4K 144hz monitor. It gets the job done and it's nice for casual gaming. And I'm plugged into an Asus gaming laptop for these results, so it is running off of a Nvidia GeForce GTX 1050. Also my monitor did come with an HDMI cable in the box, so that was a nice addition. It also comes with the hardware for a wall mount. My only complaint is that out of the box the picture was super washed out. With some adjustments I got it back to normal, but it is worth noting that you may have to make some adjustments

title: Shocked to find these THIS good at the $100 price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 16, 2020
text: These are razor-thin, and though they do have a bezel, it's modest. I haven't "performance-tested" these to any strenuous extent, but they've performed exceptionally-well for both office work and casual gaming (ark/minecraft/satisfactory). Especially-nice is the wall-wart DC power supply - I've always had heavier 3prong power cables going to monitors, and on a 3x stand they can be rather bulky and tough to hide - these, instead, are very thin wires for power, which were very easy to hide. Hypothetically, if the wall-wart ever fails, it ought to be easy to replace, rather than chucking the screen for a bad supply.Also like the dual-HDMI for future flexibility.As other reviews have mentioned, the sound is acceptable for the "oops I forgot to switch to my receiver output" sound, rather than having no sound at all, and definitely would be sufficient for office computers rather than having desktop speakers for email sounds.Would definitely recommend these to anyone looking for a simple screen solution.

text: So the most important thing to me is low response time. Though I did just watch a video saying the lower the refresh rate on a monitor the higher the response time. I'm not sure if that's the case with this monitor to be honest but I also am not fortunate enough to have a bunch of monitors lying around to test this. All around though for having 2 of them side by side and looking through all the features/options along with using them for a good couple years, they're *good enough* for the average trihard gamer or editor. If you just want a bland normal monitor, this isn't for you, get the cheaper ASUS monitor in your searches but if you're a budget gamer then grab this one and set that picture mode to FPS and have fun.

title: Borderline unusable after 8 months.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 11, 2022
text: While the monitor was easy to mount, had great picture quality and a very refreshingly good backlight - the panel has over time gotten worse and worse over the course of 8 months and now has black horizontal bars progressively worsening and making the monitor unusable and the RMA is... well 15 days. Not very great.Ultimately I'd rather pay an extra 30-50$ to have a product that will last 10 years and have a longer warranty in case of clearly very defective hardware in my case. I write this while using a ASUS monitor that is over a decade old still going strong, just a slightly fading backlight.The black bars began whenever the monitor was shut down for a long period of time, and would take a good 30m-1hr to clean itself of them, so I began keeping the monitor on indefinitely - and now the bars after a month of that fix are spawning on their own volition. Will have to throw it out.

title: Great Monitor, Horrible Speakers

text: As a monitor in the lower price range, this a wonderful monitor that does all it says it can do...except for when it comes to audio.  The sound is the highest quality tin can and string system I have ever heard.  At first I thought my 9 year old set up our hi tin fi system and connected it to my computer but I was mistaken.  These speakers sound like everyone has a cat voice filter with a hit of helium.  I was expecting Alvin, Simon, and Theodore to jump out of the box singing some Lady Gaga.  That would have made this perfect.I'm sure you are asking yourself, why would he give this three stars. Like I said, it's a great monitor and I really was not expecting the best speakers.  Had the seller not mentioned the speakers in the description I would have given them 5 stars.  The speakers then would have been an interesting surprise and not a disappointing feature.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Colors look off?  Check the refresh rate setting
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
text: Like others when I first connected this monitor the colors looked off and 'washed out' as it were so I came to the reviews to see what others said.  True enough the refresh rate setting the monitor is set to is the key here.It seems Windows defaults to 60 hertz.To check and change you'll want to right click anywhere on your desktop and go to display settings, then 'advanced display settings'.  From here you should see 'display adapter properties for display 1' or something similar.A new box pops up with info for your video card/monitor.  Select the 'monitor' tab along the top.  If it's set to 60 try changing it and hopefully this helps!

title: Great Inexpensive Monitor with muted speakers
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
text: This monitor is very nice.  Thin bezels, light weight, thin body.  Purchased it to allow a dual monitor set-up while working from home and it's perfect for that.  Overall build quality is great and it has 2 HDMI ports and 1 VGA port in addition to 3.5mm audio in and audio out.Color and brightness were a little off using the default factory setting, but it was easily tuned.The only real quibble I have is with the speakers, which appear to be firing out the rear of the monitor rather than the front causing the volume to be muted even at full volume.  I think it may have been a design compromise in order to maintain the thin profile and narrow bezels.But who uses the built in speakers anyway?  For what I bought it for it's perfect.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Differences over time
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
text: In total I've bought 3 of these monitors. I bout 2 back in 2018 and a third in 2020. The first two I bought have been amazing and where a step up from what I had previously. In 2020 I decided to get a third one, having purchased a new GPU. The third one, was not as high quality as the other two in picture. The colors don't pop the way the other two do. I thought this was a setting issue and configured the third to match the other two in at least color. Unfortunately that did not work. It seems that the newest monitor has just more blue in it than it's older counter parts and it drives me nuts. I've tried everything I canthink of to match the colors going as far as to only use DP to HDMI cables but nothing works. If you have purchased these in the past and want to get more to match what you have be aware this might be an issue.

text: My husband purchased this monitor for me for a late birthday gift because we were both tired of sharing his monitor. He has his Xbox and I have my PC and was rather annoyed that I couldn't play my games or do any work when he got off work; so he fixed it. 😅 I love it!It's light enough to carry to another room or if we decide to play side by side, unlike his. product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: As long as you don't listen...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
text: Easy set up, nice picture, good size, the right price... what could go wrong, right?  Well... Just hope the speakers on your computer are working, or you have headphones, or a blue tooth speaker, or two soup cans and a string.  ANYTHING will sound better than the speakers in this monitor.  Granted, I really don't NEED the monitor to have speakers, I have plenty of other options.  It just would have been nice.  I mean, when a solid track of classic rock sounds like a suspect sign of alien life from deep space, wellllll, you get what I mean.  Buy it for the picture and rub the styrofoam packing pieces together if you want a rich acoustic experience.

title: Good monitors for the price

text: I use a pair of these for working from home and light gaming.Two minor complaints that I don't think even justify taking a star away:The speakers are back facing and expectedly low quality which is unfortunate because the monitor has dual hdmi inputs so I have one that I switch to a Switch dock. When doing that, I end up using headphones because I can't hear well enough to play.I would have preferred a button to quickly switch inputs somewhere more accessible than the location on the back where it is difficult to get to and impossible to see without being behind the monitor. Like most monitors, I rarely change colors, brightness or any of the other settings after initial setup. But I switch inputs very frequently and both the button placements make that a pain.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: A great buy for the money.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 18, 2020
text: We purchased several of these units to support staff working from home and they are well worth the money!The screen and base took about two minutes to assemble, and connected via HDMI to home computers/laptops immediately with no issues. AND the screen comes with an HDMI cable! So no need to purchase that in addition.The picture quality is incredible. I haven't tried to change any of the settings yet, but there are display options that can be navigated easily via the side buttons, including volume control for the monitor. The sound quality is not great for music, but I don't plan to use it for anything other than conference calls, for which it should be fine.We are really happy with this purchase and will get more of this brand if we need it in the future.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 16, 2021
text: Prior to purchase, I did ask it it would work on a Mac.  I was told that it would 'probably' need some type of adapter to work.  That information was correct,  My Mac is MacBook Pro Mid 2012.  I did a quick search and found  and purchased the Amazon Basic MiniDisplay Port Thunderbolt Adapter - Compatible with Apple iMac and MacBook. Very inexpensive and worked right out the box, just a quick and simple plug and play with both the monitor and  adapter..This monitor is incredible for the price with with vibrant color and crystal clear type, and no fussing with settings, just worked beautifully right out of the box!Simple set up, works great, Highly recommended!

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Reviewing as a $99 Retro Arcade Monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 12, 2019
text: Okay I'm STILL blown away by the price, $99 for a 75hz HD 24" HD monitor ... let that sink in for a minute ... I was SUPER skeptical about the quality, picture, speed and build for just $99, well I'm happy to say, I'm really happy I purchased this monitor, is the picture quality the same as my Asus 144Hz 1440p monitor? Heck no, not even close, however for $99 it's PERFECT for my arcade cabinet playing older retro games and some gamecube and wii games, the panel works perfect in emulating old 4:3 games and it's working great at 75Hz with no tearing in any games so far with V-Sync turned on.I truly think if you have never had a true gaming monitor, this would work well for you, if you have a current modern gaming monitor (120-240Hz) this would not impress you except its only $99!!!! I paid over $450 for my current gaming monitor and if I was on a super tight budget, this monitor would work perfectly!!!

title: Good quality and meets the need, poor sound
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 19, 2018
text: These monitors a what I would call good.  They do the job, have a good image quality and simple controls.  They are not high end devices, but they will get the job done and the price point is very attractive too.  One of the 4 I bought had some weird image quality issues that came and went only once, never again since that one day.  The controls are simple and easy to use, pretty standard stuff.  The connectivity is good with HDMI and VGA, DVI seems to be a thing of the past.  DP would be nice but not required in my setup.  Overall these monitors are a good value and meet my needs for a good price.  The only complaint I have is the sound quality.  If you need to use the onboard speakers be prepared that they will sound very “tiny” and have absolutely no bass to them at all.  They work in a pinch if you have nothing else but you will definitely want an external speaker set.

This would be a good thing to add to the website when going over return requirements. I have since sent 2 emails and have gotten zero response. Save frustration and just buy local so you have someone willing to back a product warranty. I have since purchased a Phillips monitor because I could not do without one for work. Still waiting on a response from the company to make this right.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Extremely high Ghosting, Good Monitor aside from that
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
text: The first thing you notice when you start gaming is that this monitor has a large amount of Ghosting. If you don't know much about gaming or monitors, ghosting is when the pixels on the monitor cannot change color quick enough to keep up with what the PC/Console is doing.In short, when playing games, you will notice pixels (black pixels especially) create a blurring effect along your screen. This can be partially fixed by using the Monitor's 'Overdrive' function, but it still remains either way.Aside from the ghosting, the monitor is very good.A fair warning, however, is to make sure you look at your PC/Console. This monitor has 2 HDMI ports and 1 VGA Port.

title: Great for the price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
text: Running this monitor for the last two weeks off my GTX 660, and it was a great purchase. For $100 you get a very flexible monitor that passes most of my baseline tests. No dead pixels on arrival, none of the spotting other people have had. Initially plugging it in, pixels were very white. Be sure to set up your graphics card for 75hz, and then I further adjusted contrast and brightness until colors felt correct and the whiteness went away. I run it with low brightness and higher than normal contrast, and adjust the back-light level to compensate. Considering this monitor is over half as cheap as other similar monitors on the market, its a great buy.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
text: I bought 2 of these monitors and one of them wouldn't turn on. I discovered that if I swapped the AC adapters, that monitor would turn on, and the other wouldn't. I did some rummaging and scavenged 12V 2.0A adapter with the same size plug that works with them, so I thought I was good to go. But then the other AC adapter died too. So now I can only use one of the monitors at a time, with the AC adapter I scavenged out of my closet.The AC adapters that came with the monitors say that they are 12V 2.5A.UPDATE: I bought a couple Facmogu 12V 3.0A AC adapters and now I can use both monitors. I'm bumping this up to 3 stars. Still about the least expensive monitors with VESA mounts I can find, even with the extra cost of the replacement AC adapters.

title: Budget monitor full of surprises

text: When you take into consideration the extremely low cost of this monitor you start to realize how much of a bargain it truly is. The 24-inch size is perfect, its thin, 75Hz refresh rate is a nice addition, dual HDMI inputs, built-in speakers. Picture quality and brightness is more than acceptable, all around I'm extremely impressed with this monitor.The only thing I might caution potential buyers with is that the box clearly states in multiple places that if you ever need to submit a warranty claim on this monitor that it must be shipped in its original packaging. I usually toss that kind of stuff then if a warranty claim needs to be submitted, scrounge up packaging that'll do the job. In this case using anything but the original box will result in a void of warranty. Just keep that in mind.If that doesn't bother you than go for it, you won't be disappointed and in fact you may even be a bit impressed.

title: Solid office monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 9, 2019
text: I bought five of these for the office.  First time for this brand name so I of course read all the reviews and saw that most of them were for game players.  Since the reviews were favorable and the monitor was so inexpensive then there was absolutely no reason it could not be counted on for standard graphic use in every day business use.  Very nice 24" large monitor, very bright, and very configurable.  Very light.  Comes with a vga cable and the screw driver to screw in the base (its the little things ).  Not going to rehash the specs here. One monitor was having flickering issue but these monitors self configure according to frequency so, went into the menu reset the monitor, and replugged it back in, issue solved.  No complaints from employees, very good monitor at the price.  The only thing left to wait for is its longevity.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Great bang for the buck!

text: At only 75Hz, and 1080p it’s not the best on the market for gaming... BUT definitely don’t count it out! Color is amazing (what else do you expect from Sceptre?) could be brighter and the sound is garbage.  Sorry, but gaming on Monitor speakers is not going to be good. I put on my headset and immediately forget. The picture is great and there is little to no ghosting! For games that don’t require high FPS, or if you have a 1000 series Nvidia card, it’s great! Overall it is a great starter monitor for a budget rig!  I have two and use them every day. Won’t replace them until 4K gaming goes past 60 FPS.

title: How this monitor has lasted over the year
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 17, 2020
text: Overall, the monitor is above average, especially at its price point. The only downside to this monitor is longevity, I am writing this review about a week before a year of use with this monitor. I use this monitor heavily, practically every day, numerous hours of the day (bc I have no life lol), so that should be also factored into this.The one negative thing I can say is that the pixels tend to "linger?" a little after I've used it for so long (Kinda hard to explain but basically, if you have a black circle flying across a white background, this circle will be more like a bunch of overlapping circles flying across the background, not sure the cause of it, but it can sometimes make certain games have a slight additional motion blur that is mostly noticeable on high contrasting pictures.) Doesn't make the monitor unusable, but something to take note of, may be worse in another year. Does 75 hrtz, 1080 p no issues with that, sweet spot in terms of size as well for 1080 pWould I recommend it? If you can spend the extra money, buy something a little better for longevity, if that's what you're going for. On a budget? then this is an okay option.

title: Be aware that QC isn't amazing - I ordered 3 units and had dead pixels on two of them
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 26, 2020
text: I ordered three of these monitors because they were inexpensive and had the features I wanted. Shipping was fairly quick considering the state of the world. Installation was very easy and each monitor comes with an HDMI cable, a screwdriver, and hardware for mounting.Once configured properly (make sure you play around in your graphics card settings to get the colors and refresh rate up to par, default settings are not great) they look quite nice and are plenty bright. I love how thin they are, they're a really nice looking design. Bezels are thin but are not flush with the monitor like my outgoing HPs. They are quite light which is nice.However, two of my three units have dead pixels, and I'm debating returning them all and getting a different brand, since I'm not confident they're being tested adequately before being boxed up, and I don't want to go back and forth ten times to get units without flaws. Which is really a shame - otherwise they are solid monitors, and with them being so inexpensive, corners had to be cut somewhere. Some people may not mind a dead pixel or two, but I'm going to look elsewhere and consider sending these back.

title: Great "Travel Monitor" for extended trips.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
text: I hate working on small monitors.  If I travel >1 week, I can easily pack this monitor into my large suitcase.  It takes very little space, deconstructs easily, and weighs very little.  For me, it is perfect if I am to be gone for more than one week and see my self using my computer a lot while gone.  Every laptop has an HDMI out or adapter available.  No, the color accuracy is not perfect but I find the picture quality surprisingly bright and acceptable given the cost - and if it breaks while traveling - well it was not a huge investment.  Even the power adapter is very light weight.  Perfect for my needs.

title: Great picture, consider sound needs

text: This is a nice monitor, easy to assemble, easy to adjust forward or backward. It is thin, light and attractive and provides an excellent picture (try some 4K samples on YouTube). The two (2) HDMI ports are what grabbed me. The sound output is a problem for me (old ears perhaps). Obviously a thin monitor has tiny speakers so the sound quality is marginal. The volume was my issue, I couldn't get it loud enough. You could add some speakers although that doesn't work on my desk. I did call Sceptre support and they were prompt and great to work with. I also have their 50" tv which has been perfect for price and performance. If only I had better ears or space for speakers.

title: Regular monitor, termine devolviendolo.

text: El monitor es grande, liviano y relativamente fácil de manejar.La razón por la cual le puse 3 estrellas y termine devolviendo el monitor son varias, acá los pros y contras... O mas bien contras y pros:Contras:* El monitor me llego con una linea negra en la parte superior de ma pantalla, no eran pixeles muertos, mas bien como una raya de lapiz.* Los colores en el monitor no eran nada vivos, eran opacos, noté que mi viejo monitor Samsung de 19 pulgadas tenia mejor imagen.* El volumen del sonido integrado era pesimo, honestamente no debieron haberle puesto sonido integrados y ahorrar ese dinero bajandole el precio aun mas (Con un precio aun mas bajo podría uno ignorar los otros problemas) o mejorando la imagen.Pros:* Obviamente muy económico, por ese precio, si no hubiese tenido la raya en la pantalla me hubiese quedado con el.* Buena resolución, no es como tal un pro, por que se espera, pero ajam...

title: Monitor is not 24 inches.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 3, 2022
text: I ordered this Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor monitor in October. I received it right away. When I removed it from the box and hooked up it was not 24 inches. It was 21 3/4. When I tried to return, I ordered another one which I was assured by customer service it would be 24 inches. It was not. The return became problematic as well. Now I have been billed for two monitors (even though I returned both of them at the same time after many phone calls to customer service. One monitor may be credited soon but is still on my bank statement and the other seems to be in limbo. I am so disappointed that this has taken a month  of mishaps. I really needed the monitor 3 weeks ago but will not order again from this company. The description and the box is misleading. I was told this product was removed. Apparently not. I hope AMAZON credits me back right away for the two monitors as they promised. I have bee a reliable customer of AMAZON for years.

text: It's not as thin as you'd expect if you are using the VESA mount, as the attachment for the desk stand sticks out of the back of the monitor about 1/2 of an inch even when you are not using it.  To compensate, the manufacture includes four 1/2" threaded extensions for the VESA attachment to clear it.  As I'm using this monitor attached to a music stand, the extra 1/2" does make a difference ( using it an electronic sheet music display along with an Android TV box and MobileSheets Pro ).  Works great for this purpose, as the dimming function can dim the display to a reasonable level for performance use.  Except for the VESA mounting screwup, a great monitor.Pros:Great Price!Wide dimming rangeThin (top half is only 1/2" thick)Cons:VESA mounting extension required to clear fixed desktop bracket

title: Versa mounts, nice picture, terrible speakers.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2018
text: I bought this monitor over others primarily for its Versa mounts. It offers a nice display that is true to color, a good balance of cool to warm tones. The display is very thin and has a narrow frame. It comes featured with 2 HDMI ports; not sure why you would need 2 for a computer monitor but nice to have I guess. It also has VGA. The audio in & audio out ports are a nice feature but the speakers are so terrible they wont get used. The speakers on my laptop are better that these. It has a very... small sound. A disappointment but not a big loss as I would have bought the monitor had it not had any speakers. I almost deducted a star for the poor speakers but since it's still a good value compared to monitors without speakers I am still giving it a 5 star rating.

title: Sleep mode
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 23, 2023
options: Style: 24" 75Hz Blue Light Shift | Pattern: Monitor
text: I like this monitor with one glaring exception. All monitors I've ever had automatically go into sleep mode when the video signal turns off. So if your computer is set to power off the monitor after let's say 5 minutes of no activity, all other monitors will turn off within seconds of that. Not this monitor. The BEST this monitor can do is turn itself off after 30 minutes at a minimum. That means your monitor will be blazing away for 30 minutes AFTER you told it to turn off. Incomprehensible.

title: 6 months later, horizonal lines across the screen
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2022
text: I loved this monitor when I bought it 6 months ago. Its slim, lightweight, and takes up minimal space. The quality is fine for emails, working in spreadsheets, browsing the web. I don't use it for gaming. However, 6 months later, there's now 2 horizonal lines going across the monitor, which is a sign the resolution in the screen is failing. I googled how to fix this, and there's no fix that is working (restarting, adjusting resolution, using new cables, etc.) This should not be happening only 6 months into using the monitor, its basically brand new! I'm very upset this is happening, as I'm past the return window and now I'm going to try and file a manufactures defect with Sceptre itself.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Terrible main display or display in general
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 22, 2018
text: i bought this about 4-5 months ago and i had it as a main monitor for a while until i bought my new monitor. as a main monitor, it was terrible. it has an issue of going black every so often for a few seconds after a month. i assumed it was my graphics card. i put another monitor on the HDMI slot this one was on and moved this one over, issue still happened on this monitor while the other monitor on the slot this was in didn't have that affect. if you are looking for a second display that is above 60hz and are not really going to look at this monitor at all, i would then recommend it. but if you are planning on using this for a main display or a display you will be looking at for a while, this ain't it chief. i would recommend paying a little more if you want something over 60hz, cause this definitely will be more trouble than it is worth. i did have an issue of it not being 60hz but i found out a few weeks ago that it is user error, not the monitor. i have tried changing HDMI ports on the monitor as well thinking one of the ports was bad and that didn't fix the issue. i tried the VGA slot, that didn't fix the issue. the only thing i really enjoyed about this monitor was the colors were really good and was very vibrant but besides that i don't have anything else good to say about it. speakers sounded terrible but i can't fault them on that because of the price. there are better monitors out there for a little more, go check them out instead

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: You CAN'T return this item so beware of that, and the product quality is terrible...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 20, 2021
options: Style: 24" 75Hz Blue Light Shift | Pattern: Monitor
text: The product itself was terrible enough, then the customer service was even worse. You basically can't return this item despite what the seller claims. Here is some more detail:The product itself was a piece of junk, the picture quality was grainy and pixelated (not sure why they call this a "Gaming Monitor"), and the lighting was super difficult to adjust, you need to go behind the monitor and click like 8 different buttons to be able to simply adjust the brightness of the monitor.When I tried to return the item I realized the seller actually doesn't work with regular Amazon return options (Kohl or UPS drop offs). So I had to wait for a week for them to issue a Fedex label. When I went to Fedex the label didn't cover the full cost of return, so I had to pay an extra $20 (Yes, 20 with a zero!) just to ship the product back to the seller. 5 days after it was delivered (with Fedex proof of delivery), seller still said they couldn't issue my refund because they "can't scan the item back". I eventually had to call Amazon and file a complaint and claim my refund under their Guaranty of Return. It is now weeks after I have returned this item, spent an extra $20 on shipping and still waiting to get refunded. Avoid this seller at all cost.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2018
text: Let me be clear about this, the monitor itself is a huge improvement on the one it replaced...widescreen experience is taking some time to get used to, but it is more than I expected picture and clarity wise...Now the bad...I can only say it in plain deckplate terms, the speakers suck, period. Even more "tinny" sounding than the Samsung tv/monitor I had. I've lost some hearing over the years, and even I can tell that these internal speakers don't have a very wide range at all...they only produce the highest treble frequencies, and the mid range and lower bass frequencies are non existent. So if you get one of these monitors, buy it only for the picture quality, NOT for sound.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Frustrating
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 6, 2021
text: After taking the time to set up a home office I went to plug these monitors in, excited that it was the last step. After plugging them in they said they would not detect an input and immediately went into sleep mode. I thought maybe it was an issue with my computer or USBC hub. Spent a few hours trying to figure out if it was a software, driver, windows or computer problem. Couldn't find any solution. Then drove to Best Buy to but a new cable and hub at $150. Plugged the new hub in, same issue. At this point I began to suspect the monitors but how could 2 be bad?! Plugged computer into my TV and it immediately extended the desktop. At this point I went back and checked out the monitors. I was using the supplied HDMI cables. There is a plastic bezel around each input that extends out about 1/8 inch. The plastic around the HDMI input pushes up against the plastic bezle and makes it so that the HDMI cable is not fully inserted into the monitor. I pushed it in hard and the monitor turned on. I then had to literally break and Dremel around the HDMI plug in the monitor to create clearance for the plug. This level of stupidity by the manufacturer is incredible.  I would like 4 hours of my life back please. 🤦‍♂️

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)

title: Fairly good product but with HDMI design flaws
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 12, 2021
text: I bought 2 monitors and they seem ok. Picture quality is good. But the HDMI slots are inferior. I have to fight to keep them in and the monitors working. All 4 HDMI slots are weak and won't hlld the cable. I may have to buy a vga to hdmi adapter just to get them work properly. Thats because that adapter screws in and it will be a tight fit. Thats if the vga slot works, haven't gotten the adapters yet to test it. Fairly good product but watch out for the HDMI slots. On one monitor i may have said it's a fluke, but both monitors and all the HDMI slots means it a manufacturing design issue.

title: Wall Adapter highly subject to RF fields.

text: Unit looks and works well. I summarily replaced the power adapter with this one from AMAZON which solved the problem (see my review on that unit.)[UL Listed] Chanzon 12V 2A 24W AC DC Switching Power Supply Adapter (Input 100-240V, Output 12 Volt 2 Amp) Wall Wart Transformer Charger for DC12V CCTV Camera LED Strip Light (6Ft Cord, 24 Watt Max)That adapter is well-built and has a ferrite filter in the DC line.

text: This is a solid monitor. It works perfectly via HDMI with my MacBook Pro. No remotes to fiddle with, all controls are buttons on the side, which I prefer to a remote for a mere computer monitor. My only complaint is the power brick. I'm used to monitors just using a cord, but this is a power brick that plugs into the monitor with a circular plug. The problem is that the cable to the brick is way too short, so it's awkward with the brick either lying on my desk plugged into an extension cord, or dangling above the floor since the monitor is some distance from the edge of the desk.

title: Nice $100 Monitor, but no HDMI to DVI cables
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2019
text: The monitor is very nice, and the price is excellent.  Quality seems fine, but I have only been using for a day.  My comment is that I had only DVI outputs from my computer, so only went with this model because it explicitly says it comes with conversion cables so that DVI could be used.  These conversion cables are not supplied in the items that are currently shipping.  If you can use VGA or HDMI, this is not an issue.  In my case it was, so I had to immediately head out to Walmart to purchase an HDMI to DVI cable.  Be careful.

title: Unreliable outages

text: I was initially satisfied with my purchase--as a teacher primarily using this as a second monitor extension to my laptop, I was ecstatic to find a deal! title: So far so good!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 19, 2019
text: So far so good. I got two 24" monitors for my 2015 MacBook Air. For one monitor, I bought a Mini Display Port to HDMI cable. For the other monitor, I bought an HDMI to HMDI cable, then an HDMI Port to USB-3.0 cable. I learned how to do it from an entry on Quora called "How can I connect my MacBook Air to 2 external monitors?" posted in 2017. I had already downloaded Display Link for MacOS Sierra when I had another monitor. The set up of hardware was easy, it has pretty good brightness. The 24" is pretty big, I considered sending it back for the 22" but then I figured it's fine. This is for home office purposes.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Started having issues with monitor after 1 year and 5 months
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 30, 2021
text: I got this monitor in April 2020 as I was working from home due to the pandemic.  I've always enjoyed the quality of the monitor for the price point.  However, it's now September 2021, and the monitor has started pixelating the color, there are blue streaks throughout the screen, and it randomly goes black.  I expect anything, even at this price point, to last more than a year and 5 months.  I would not purchase this brand again.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Excellent image, but those speakers...

text: This is not the best display you could get, but it's great for the price. It's a perfect second monitor for me because it's bigger than my laptop's display, but has the same max refresh rate. I purchased this not knowing it came with speakers, so finding out there were two built-in was a nice bonus for me. Unfortunately, they are utter garbage. I can get away with just using the laptop speakers, but I strongly recommend you purchase some external speakers if you're using this for a PC build.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Broke within 10 minutes of use
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 29, 2022
text: Bought this monitor as a cheap 2nd monitor after my last one became pixelated. Needed something just to have on the side so went for the cheap option - DONT DO THIS.Got it out the box and set up very easy. Worked great for 10-15min then the display began to jump and so naturally, I turned it off thinking something was wrong HDMI-wise. Nope! The screen is now 100% black even though it will still run applications like it is working. Tried different HDMI things but not an HDMI issue, it is the monitor.DO not buy unless you want to replace within the first day of having it. Customer service is a joke and is no help, worst $80 ever spent.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)

text: For the price, it is a decent desktop monitor.PROS:The 75Hz refresh rate allows for better looking graphics for better gaming systems.Build quality seems sturdy enoughCONS:Backlighting is always too bright, even with brightness turned down, it always has this too bright look to it.Built in speakers are mediocre at best.Screen has a glossy sheen to it so any light or windows behind you reflect it making it much more difficult to see what is on the screen.Recommended for a basic 24" screen provided you're aware of the limitations.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Nice product but no power!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 23, 2020
text: I ordered this product on 6.16.20 and received it shortly after.  The outer packaging advertises the item inside and is held closed with clear shipping tape.  The outer packaging had normal wear and tear, meaning scuffs and small edge peels, but nothing that would infer that the inside product could be damaged.  Once opened the product is tightly packaged in a Styrofoam shell with a static cling screen protector.  It comes with screws to mount on the stand, mount on a wall mount and even a magnetized Phillips screwdriver (that was a major plus for me bc I can always use a new screwdriver) as well as an HDMI cable and power adapter.  The size of the 24" monitor is very nice, with barely 1/2 inch trim around the screen.  I work from home using a laptop, so I was very excited to work with the monitor but when I plugged it into the power strip...nothing.  I plugged into the wall...nothing.  I plugged it into another outlet on a different wall...nothing.  I took it to the bathroom and plugged it in...nothing.  Kitchen - nothing. Living room - nothing.  I contacted their customer service via email that very night.  They replied within 24 hours, asking me to register the item and provide them with the model and serial number.  Due to the 1 year warranty they mailed me a new power adapter free of charge.  It should be here within a week.  I will update my review when I see if that was the problem or not. Fingers crossed that is all it is!

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Ok Quality but poor image and over scanning
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2018
text: Purchased this for a home office to use with a laptop with a NVIDIA GTX1060 and Intel HD graphics card. Since the screen was on the cheaper side, had VESA mounts, supported HDMI at 75Hz/1080P, and came with great reviews I figured it was a great deal. Out of the box the quality looked decent and came with everything needed including tools for assembly.I was soon disappointed when I connected it to my laptop. Initially I noticed that the screen was over scanning (the images extended beyond the edge of the screen). The desktop extended past preventing the use of several windows features, and programs would span both screens when clicking the maximize button. Secondly the text with many applications, including Microsoft Office suite was very blurry. I expected some blurriness since this is not an IPS screen, but this was bad.I tried messing with video card settings, using different video cards (laptop has two), using Windows screen calibration and ClearText tuning and different video cables - no improvement. The monitor settings are very limited so they provide no help.Ultimately I ended up returning after Amazon Support was unable to diagnose the problem.  If you're looking for a cheap screen and don't care about image quality then this is a good deal. If you care somewhat about image quality or  have a hard time reading computer screens - do yourself a favor and spend a little extra on a decent screen.

title: Speakers are way too quiet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 5, 2018
text: Pros: I am impressed with the performance,looks and screen size to price ratio of this monitor. I replaced an old 21" dell monitor with the above product and the difference is day and night.Cons: I specifically picked this monitor over the 2018 version because this one came with built in speakers. I have a couch right next to my desk and I like to sit down and watch a movie on my computer. Sadly the speaker are so beyond quiet that it is impossible to watch a movie from the couch. By default the monitors volume is set to 50 but even turning the volume up to 100 (via the buttons on the back) makes next to no difference. I have tried various things to increase the volume such as using different drivers or switching the audio quality from cd to dvd but nothing helped. Unless you sit right in front of the monitor you won't be able to enjoy a movie or listen to music. -2 Stars for that.

I have bought it and used it much to my chagrin with utterly dismal brightness and as good as sound quality as a 1992 honda civic (not suped up)... Ultimately I'm returning it because it was not what I need or want and as a word of caution to whoever else is looking for similar qualities. I'm guessing a little more bucks gets a better product.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Dead
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
text: I installed it, turned it on and it wouldn't come on for a while. I tried wiggling wires around. The menu worked but it would go black. So I changed the USB cable although the first one was good. So while I was reading the manual page the screen came on. The screen looked awesome. I diddled with the brightness and contrast until we were pleased. So my son played with it for 5 hours. We were happy. So my son closed the laptop lid and went to bed. Then when my son opened the laptop lid we got a black monitor screen. So I tried to get it to work. The menu never worked anymore. If I fired it up, the screen Sceptre would turn red but it wouldn't start up. It would sometimes say that my USB wasn't plugged in. I tried both of the 2 ports but neither one worked. After fussing with it for 2 hours it still didn't work. So I thought it was my laptop who had a problem.  So I moved to a TV set with a USB port. I tried that and it worked perfectly.So I assume the  Sceptre  monitor had a bad solder joint on an internal circuit board.  It has an awesome screen but I can't spend hours to have another one break again.  My time is worth than the cost of the this whole monitor!  So, if you've got the time to make sure to get a good one and or won't throw it against the wall in  frustration, go ahead to buy one.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: FRUSTRATED!!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 8, 2022
text: All I need is a second monitor so I can work from home. I bought this one after reading the reviews. However, I believe the people that said they liked this monitor....were mistaken and had bought a different one. I received the first one, yes...the first one, without a power cord.  I thought that the box had looked like it had previously been open and so I asked Amazon to send me a different one. I just got the second one. The first had definitely been opened, for the packaging of the second was completely different. I set up the monitor and it doesn't work! I've tried several different HDMI cables, none of them connect with my computer. The instructions say that when you press the "M" button, the OSD menu pops up. WRONG...nothing! The screen remains black. The only thing that changes is the little power button. That's the only way I know it's on. Needless to say, I'm returning this one too and will not buy from this company again.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Superb!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 3, 2019
text: I work in tech support and I use these monitors for work every single day. They are crisp clean and responsive. On my breaks, I launch my PS4 and play a quick game of Call of Duty and they work great.  I'm sure gamers and those in the visual production fields might want something technically superior, but for most people, these monitors will be more than sufficient. If you buy a model with speakers, be aware that they are HORRIBLE. Okay for system sounds, but that's about it.

title: It's Fine. Should Be $50. Worst Viewing Angle I Have Ever Seen.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
text: The monitor looks quite nice with thin bezels and overall thin and lightweight build. The image quality is not very good although it does get pretty bright. I use with a Mac and when Night Shift is turned on and you enter full screen mode on the monitor the screen auto turns on it's warmest setting, so it turns orange. Seems to work normally when not in fullscreen viewing. The worst part about the monitor is the viewing angle. Unless you are looking directly in the center and it is set perfectly to eye level it is unusable. Even turning your head to look at the edges shifts the colors and brightness. Overall it is way overpriced for what you get. Might be ok for basic productivity but not good for gaming or media consumption.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Bought two monitors, but 1 stopped working suddenly 4 months later
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020
text: While they work, these monitors are pretty good quality. The brightness definitely impacts the richness of color (the bright you go, the more washed out colors get, but that's to be expected) and the sound quality isn't great, but I don't know a whole lot of people who aren't plugged in or connected via bluetooth anyway.The reason I preface this review with "while they work" is because I bought two monitors and one of them unceremoniously stopped working 4 months in. It won't turn on at all and simply stopped working while I was in the middle of using it. It's plugged into a surge protector, all other devices are working fine, and this thing has never been hit, spilled on, dropped, or even moved from this one desk I set it up on since taking it out of the box 4 months ago. I've never had this happen to me before and I've worked on dozens of different monitors, both communal and personal. I'm going to submit a warranty request and will update my review based on service response.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Decent monitor for the price if it doesn't try to kill itself!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019
text: I bought two of these monitors in November 2018 to put in a dual-monitor stand and everything worked as expected. Today one of these monitors turned itself off and on, and for about 30 minutes an effigy of my file manager and terminal were visible.  Since I have two of the same monitor, I attempted swapping their power cables and HDMI cables (not provided) with no effect.  After resetting the monitor's settings, adjusting the refresh rate from 50hz to 75hz, and power cycling the monitor after each change the issue appears to have stopped.  I have no idea if they would allow me to RMA it and their office isn't open on weekends, so I'll have to call them on a break or something from work when the monitor isn't in front of me.EDIT: Now the same issue happened to my other monitor!  Thankfully I only spent $200 getting a pair of these monitors. I'll be ordering new monitors before I think about attempting the RMA process, though because the issue is intermittent I suspect I'll be out $200 when I put these things in a dumpster myself.

title: DEFINTELY NOT NEW!

text: I purchased this monitor and was surprised that the listing did not display "open box" cause this monitor was definitly not new. The box had a sticker from another address that had been mostly ripped off the cardboard. There were loose screews at the bottom of the box (not in a sealed plastic) for the base of the monitor. The monitor had obvious smudges and liquid stains or spills that had been on the screen for a while. Lastly, the monitor did not come with a power cord so I can't plug it in to the wall. I understand the monitor's don't always come with a cable to connect to the computer but this one didn't even have a cable to connect to the wall.If they are going to sell a monitor like this, they should at least mention it is an open box item and not try to sell it as a new item.

title: Save your money and patience.

text: VERY bad product and horrible customer service. The monitor lasted barely 3 months being used simply for word processing a few hours a week. Started with flickering, then went totally black except for some random lines. Next day it turned on, then 10 minutes into turning it on, it abruptly turned off and will not turn back on. Customer service is nonexistant. Pointing me all over the place and resolving nothing. PLUS they make it clear in their FAQ that they'll want ME to pay shipping on their dead product. Shameful.Amazon needs to rectify this situation since Sceptre clearly won't. I shouldn't be out of the money and a monitor in only 3 months.Update: over a week after contacting Sceptre's support and I STILL do not have any idea what's happening with repair/replacement/refund. Amazon themselves are not assisting, nor is my credit card protection plan because they need information from Sceptre who is not responding to any emails/calls.

title: You get what you pay for. Broke after 11 months of use.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
text: Monitor was fine for about 11 months, and then suddenly the backlight broke, leaving 30% of the monitor unusably dim. Cannot realistically be used for anything. Most reviews of this monitor and of others made by Sceptre should paint a pretty clear picture: they are cheap because they have poor build quality, lots of defects right out of the box, and do not last. Overall, I'm disappointed that it broke after less than a year of use, but not surprised, as it was so inexpensive. Stay away from Sceptre. You will wind up spending less money overall if you go for a higher quality brand.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Shipped with an Internal Crack
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 27, 2020
text: The offer was too good to be true. I needed a monitor that worked for my magic mirror build and I found this one. When it shipped, I was ecstatic. The deal I found for a 75 Hz monitor was amazing. I go to fire it up just to learn it had an internal crack that messed up half to three-fourths of the screen. I try to send it back but it was past Amazon's 30-day refund. I contact the supplier, Spectre, to get a warranty to send it back, and they tell me they do not deal with "External" damage when it was an "Internal" crack in the hardware they sent me. If you are looking for a quality monitor that you can expect to work after being shipped to you, I do NOT recommend this monitor, nor this brand as their customer service in atrociously awful and hardware is cheaply made.

title: DO NOT BUY

text: When I received the first monitor, the bottom bezel was busted along with the screw being snapped in half and where the screw went being torn so you couldn't replace the screw. Amazon has replaced it at no additional cost. Great, right? Well, no, the second monitor has dead pixels across the screen. Horrible product. I have my doubts about the THIRD monitor that I am going to have to wait for.EDIT: I have received the THIRD monitor now. It is just as terrible if not worse than the others. LED light bleeding around all the edges of the monitor. I am now requesting my money back on this horrible product. I cannot believe how terrible of a monitor this is. It is sad to think that this company is thriving off of people who don't know much about technology and don't notice all the flaws of the product.Once again, D O N O T B U Y!!!

title: HDMI1 Connection Failed  Right out of Box
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 24, 2020
text: The HDMI1 connection at back of monitor failed when I first plugged in to my Surface Pro laptop.  In particular, it displayed a pop up box noting "Signal Out of Range" and "Resolution and Refresh Rate Not Supported".  The HDMI2 connection worked fine without any errors.  The same result happened when I tried with another HDMI cable.  I contacted Sceptre directly by phone for help and they advised that the HDMI1 connector was likely faulty and that I should return the monitor through Amazon.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Two duds in a row... Check the desc for details
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 29, 2020
text: I know what you're thinking, "two duds in a row probably means the problem is between the keyboard and the chair" but hear me out. We got this monitor for the good reviews. Straight away, the flickering started for the PC. We tried a different source (a PS4) and the flickering continued. We figured it's either the HDMI cable or the monitor, so we tried a different cable and still the flickering persisted. Most likely it's a defective monitor, so we returned it and here we are with another flickering monitor. We tried the same troubleshooting techniques... We also tried messing with the monitor's settings so see if there's some config causing it, but it's still an issue. So we returned it for a refund. Risk it if you want, the returns were easy, but I'd advise going with something else if you want to save time.

title: DO NOT BUY - Stopped Working Overnight After 4 Months of Gentle Use
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
text: Absolutely unacceptable. Purchased this on August 10. A mere 4 months and change of very gentle use later, and with no physical wear whatsoever, it no longer works. It does not read the hdmi input, even though the same hdmi and device connects fine to another monitor. What''s worse, when I try to experiment with the second hdmi input, I can't, because I press and press the setup button to change the input and it is completely unresponsive. So two major issues after 4 months that makes the monitor unusable: 1. hdmi input not working 2. setup button, which is the only way to change inputs, also not working.Piece. Of. Trash. For the limited use I got out of it, quite expensive.

title: I hate this monitor

text: The monitor renders well. It has tons of other issues and they became apparent after the return period. It flashes between a yellow and blue pall. Also, I don't love the yellow cast when it's in the eye saver mode, but maybe that's just how it is. What drives me crazy most about this monitor is how hard it is to change any of the settings, especially the volume. Would love to just have buttons to turn it down instead of finding the app on my MacBook where the sound is originating from and turning it down that way. This monitor sucks.

title: Doesn't work with Mac
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
text: I have a Macbook Pro 2019, am using the Apple-supplied Belkin USB-C to HDMI adapter, and have tried multiple HDMI cables (including the one supplied with this monitor) and it will not work. I have tried all of the troubleshooting that I possibly can, even the steps outlined after I contacted Sceptre Tech Support directly and no luck. My same adapters/cables/computer work just fine when I plug into other displays.From the reviews I have read, it seems like it works for some people and not others who have Macs. Maybe certain devices work better than others. At this point, I've spent hours on this and I'm really tired of troubleshooting something that is just supposed to be plug-and-play.I'll be returning these and going with different monitors.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Can't switch from VGA to HDMI inputs
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 21, 2019
text: The picture quality isn't terrible, but I'm running into a problem for my use-case. I have my work Mac plugged in via an HDMI input, and my old home PC plugged in via the VGA input. When I finish work, I can switch from HDMI to VGA via the menu buttons on the back of the monitor, but I cannot then switch back to HDMI. Every time I try, the screen goes black for a short time then reverts back to the VGA input. I have to unplug the VGA cable for it to revert to HDMI. This behavior occurs regardless of which HDMI port I use.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Button placement, and audio port use
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2022
text: I bought 2 of the 24" monitors for use in a dual monitor workstation.Primarily they are hooked to a docking station for my laptop, which has two HDMI video outputs.  Sound does come through the HDMI cable, and the monitors become a speaker selection.However, I also have these monitors connected to a desktop computer using the HDMI2 ports.  The desktop has DP and DVI output, so I am using converters to HDMI to connect to the monitors.  I then connected a 3.5mm audio cable from the desktop to one of the monitors for sound, but there is none.  It appears, from looking at the instruction manual, that I would need to be using the VGA port for that Audio In Jack to work.  I could put my DVI to VGA adapter on, but that would be sacrificing picture quality.  My daughter usually uses USB headphones with the desktop, but I am disappointed that the Audio In Jack isn't working the way I hoped it would.The buttons for these are on the back along the right side.  Yes, this is visible in the listing pictures, but I didn't really pay attention to that.  IMO, they would be better on the bottom edge, or front bottom edge.  Because these monitors are hooked to two sources, I need to be able to switch the inputs.  This now means I need to be able to access the back buttons, which is not as easy as I would like when the monitors are side by side.  I need to leave a gap between them, and turn one a little to access the buttons.  Just an inconvenience.Overall, however, the picture quality looks good so far, so that is an improvement from my older monitors.  The speakers sound like what you would probably expect from built in speakers.  Similar to the laptop speakers.

title: Good work monitor, here’s the hardware specs to mount it
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 24, 2022
text: Works just fine. For those unfortunate souls who threw away the VESA adapter bracket + screws that came in the box, you will need to buy: (1) four M4 x 20mm screws, and (2) four nylon spacers 0.5 inches long and .171 or .194 in inner diameter (ID).The manual states the screws are size  M4x10mm, but that’s only if you’re not adding spacers. Make sure you get 20mm long M4 screws if you add half inch spacers or add length accordingly if you get longer spacers.

It could just be me being use to my 144hz monitor but it doesn't seem as clear when playing games. I also wanted to point out the speakers on this monitor is lacking, and the output audio jack at the back is broken but what can you do for $140. Its okay to do school work on or browse the internet and watch YouTube on. If you're looking for a gaming monitor I would spend the extra 50 dollars and buy a 144hz monitor. My final thoughts are if you only need a monitor to browse the internet and light gaming this is it for you but don't expect anything special with this monitor.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Have one will buy another
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
options: Style: 24" 75Hz Blue Light Shift | Pattern: Monitor
text: I have one I use on my desktop, I am going to buy a second to connect to same desktop to better my work flow.The monitor does have a great picture and is easy to adjust. Most TV's and monitors today have the adjustment controls on the back, it is just the best place to put them to maximize the viewing.The speaker quality is not good at all. Even when I turn up the volume control on the monitor and on my computer the sound is still poor, so an external set of speakers is needed.The color quality is crisp and warm, however it does have some preset color setting so it can be adjusted for any person comfort.Before taking advice of the negative reviewers keep in mind Windows 10 and 11 have settings within the System for monitors as well and if you reset everything to default and then only use one set of settings you will get the results you want.Also Windows 11 is still making adjustments to their color settings, so if using Windows 11 give it time.If you are looking for a monitor for work or play this is a good choice.

title: Good 2nd Monitor for Work

options: Style: 24" 75Hz Blue Light Shift | Pattern: Monitor
text: I ordered for a 2nd monitor for my home work station, wasn’t expecting much so I was pleasantly surprised. product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Very good for the price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 14, 2020
text: As a monitor itself, it's great. Good refresh rate, picture isn't spectacular but it's definitely good enough. I use it for a mix of gaming and multitasking for online classes. Build and materials quality is surprisingly high for the price point. My biggest issues with it are a. the built in speakers and b. the fact that the monitor doesn't ask for the right resolution in a lot of games. The last issue probably won't be an issue if it's your only monitor, but it tries to use my native resolution from my laptop in a lot of games. Not a deal breaker but gets annoying when starting new games for the first time. The first issue is a little more annoying. I have to disable the audio driver for the monitor every time I start up a game, and in Warzone the chat audio will come out of the monitor by default while the game audio comes through my headset. Obviously, the speakers aren't great, but it doesn't bother me as I don't use them. Overall good for the price with just a couple issues.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Ok with Monitor Now. Took Hours & Hours to Set Up the Monitor's Picture, Colors, Sharpness, Etc.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 5, 2020
text: Was a frustrating experience. This Spectre monitor's colors, picture quality, sharpness displayed were very, blurred with washed out, dull colors, that didn't even match the colors of my laptop, and displayed very low visual quality, when I first connected my Intel Core i7 laptop with a high quality HDMI cable to this monitor's HDMI port. Frustrating because it took hours and hours to first, figure how to use the small buttons in the back of the monitor to even get to the various Picture, Color, Sharpness, Etc settings, and then, I had to go through and manually experiment with Each of the seven color settings of what was the correct color setting number on a scale of 1 to 100, and also the sharpness settings, and picture settings, etc. Finally, after many hours, finally got this monitor's display quality to close to my laptop display quality. The monitor now has more vibrant colors and I am now pleased with this monitor.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Excellent monitor at the price, served me for the 4 years since I bought it. 2 catches worth knowing
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 30, 2020
text: This monitor is great at this price point, but regarding vesa there are 2 major issues that keep me from giving it 5 stars.The vesa mount is standard 100mm x 100mm. This is great, but due to the regular monitor mount standoffs are required when using a vesa mount. This itself is no big deal, so long as one is prepared to use the standoffs.The next catch, is that the top left, and top right vesa screws thread into some nuts that are actually threaded into the case, rather than directly into the case. This does not seem like a big deal, but when mine broke (my fault) and I needed my vesa mount back, those 2 screws came undone. This meant that to get my mount back I had to dissassemble the rear monitor panel and use a wrench to hold onto those two nuts.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Sound is worse than my laptops. Picture is great.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 25, 2020
text: I will break this down easily.Amount Purchased: 2Picture: ★★★★★ (As Advertised)Sound: ★★☆☆☆Setup: ★★★★★Notes: Setting it up was easy, only needed a few screws and to twist on the base. Sound is pretty terrible but if your room is absolutely silent (including no fan noises, or probably even rain) then it may suffice. Otherwise you may want speakers or headphones. Picture quality is exactly as advertised, I have no complaints.About me as a reviewer:I'm a simple man with simple pleasures. I try to view everything as it is advertised. If it varies from the advertisement then we will have problems. If there are bonuses not mentioned in the advertisement, then it gets a better review. If there are less than advertised, then less stars.

text: Great starter or back up monitor! I really love how big it looks (24”) and it’s slim form really surprised me too. Picture quality was amazing and I could really make out small details! The brightness wasn’t too bright but just enough. There were a few things I could complain about, the viewing angles were a bit off but from straight forward it wasn’t a bother AT ALL. As well as a tad bit of ghosting which won’t really be noticeable unless you look closely. I also heard people complain about the speakers in other reviews which weren’t great but for the price it’s a miracle you get speakers included.Other then that 4/5 I recommend for anyone looking for a great screen monitor.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Honest review, after almost half a year.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 15, 2019
text: I am going to write a totally honest review. I am not going to babble on all of the cons and I am just going to give you my personal experience. So, a little side note is I received this monitor instead of a different model. I paid cheaper for the old model, and they ended up just sending me this so I'm not complaining about that. After a week or soI noticed one dead pixel, and now I have around 3 after half of a year. However, I personally am not too bugged out by these. I don't focus on them and they only show up in certain situations. But, if the pixels are going to bother you, dont buy this. I personally love this monitor. And the price? It's crazy how great this is for the price. I originally was skeptical about Sceptre as I had never heard of this brand and thought I might give them a shot. Now after half of a year with one of their monitors, I am ordering a second for a dual monitor setup. I ordered a different model than this original one, it was only around $10 more. I have to say, this gets the job done especially for the price. Give this a shot, especially if you want to save your money for other things or even two of these. Great buy, and trust me it is worth a shot!
