title: White Screens of Death
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 3, 2022
text: I purchased these monitors to use for my home office, where I needed an external monitor for each laptop back in February of 2022, so six months ago.  For context, I work in accounting and finance, so I pretty much only use these monitors for looking at excel sheets and PDF files. Nothing too wild and crazy.As of this morning, almost six months to the date, both monitors have gone white and do absolutely nothing.Research of Sceptre shows that this is the cause of the graphics card failing, but how can black and white PDFs and excel charts use up a graphics card in six months?Extremely disappointed, as I was so pleased with these and proud of this purchase until now.  Can’t recommend to anyone, and I wish I could get my money back as I now have to replace.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Great value, would buy again if I need another monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 16, 2020
text: On the left is my ASUS VG245 and on the right is my Sceptre E24. Yes the colors are a bit washed out compared to my ASUS and even after some tweaking, it still seems a little washed out, BUT for $105 and free shipping the monitor justifies itself. Comes with a HDMI cord, power adapter, nice stand even compatible with VESA wall mounting, the base tilts for good angles. No dead pixels, and the speakers sound actually good except for when turned all the way up you can hear some squeaking, but for a little over $100 to get a 1920x1080p display, speakers built in, HDMI included, VGA port, 2 HDMI ports, audio jacks, and 75hz refresh rate. It is a pretty banging monitor for the buck. Especially great for an old PC, this would be a huge upgrade, worth it.

text: I've read several reviews from the 5 star ratings on the way down the chain to the 1 star ratings. We have used this monitor over the past 6ish months in our IT department and have NEVER had any of the issues the lower ratings described. Could some of the ratings be because of maybe a bad device? YES. Not every device is 100% flawless. Humans make and assemble the monitors and I don't know a single perfect flawless human so therefore there will never be flawless merchandise. I may suggest that possibly the issues may be the result of handling from delivery to user. And since we get ours shipped usually by FedEx I probably would cautiously lean more to the side of how the monitors were handled by the user. Just my opinion.  These monitors work as expected for our IT department.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Is there even ANY quality control?
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 22, 2019
text: Ordered two monitors. They came in, one had two giant dead pixels out of the box. Ordered a replacement. It came in, but the colors didn't match the other good monitor. Yes, I am a nerd, I made sure my graphics card and display settings were the same on both monitors. Ordered another replacement, plugged it in and the colors match the first replacement, leading me to think the original monitor (the one without the dead pixels) had the color issue. Whatever, I was happy the colors finally matched, that was going to drive me crazy.Except the 2nd replacement has a problem displaying blues. There are faint vertical lines when display most shades of blue. Hard to explain, but it looks choppy. Not sure what this phenomenon is called, it's as if colors are binding but I know that's not what it is. Remember the old CRT TVs? It looks like that when displaying blue. My guess is it's some sort of power issue. And yes I double checked with different HDMI cords and inputs/outputs. I'll be replacing this one too, hopefully the third replacement is the charm. Oh, and guess what, I just noticed a dead pixel on it too. Ugh.So far two working monitors with no problems other than one of them doesn't display color properly (who knows which one does it right). And two faulty monitors, one with dead pixels, the other with some sort of display issue and dead pixels. That's not a very good percentage.It is worth noting that with the most recent replacement the shipping box and the product box both had dings in them.The ones that do work I do like. But I can't handle looking at colors that don't match, that's not acceptable. But otherwise these monitors aren't terrible. Big, sturdy, and they do look good. But no quality control.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Fantastic Display !  but one audio gotcha
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 30, 2022
options: Style: 24" 75Hz Blue Light Shift | Pattern: Monitor
text: No DVI input to monitor.  So purchased a DIV to HDMI adapter cable because wanted optimum video resolution.  (old PC has only DVI or VGA output ports).  With the Amazon adapter cable OR VGA cable; nearly perfect picture.  Very / very bright.  In fact had to reduce backlight and brightness settings to use in bedroom / office.  Monitor self detects input or can change manually.  OSD has about any setting you could possibly want. With VGA cable used 3.5mm audio input cable.  Works good.  When using the DVI to HDMI adapter cable got a surprise:  As soon as plug in HDMI to monitor; no audio thru internal speakers.  Turns out DVI does not output audio AND standard HDMI supports integrated audio; thus cuts off the 3.5mm audio input.  (no sound with DVI to HDMI cable)  For now reverted back to VGA so speaker audio would work.  Still pic quality is outstanding with 1920 X 1080: 75Hz resolution using either then DVI to HDMI cable or VGA.  Now internal monitor speakers are not boom box quality, but OK to watch an occasion You Tube or other presentation.  Will have to think about it, but might try small Soundbar along with DVI / HDMI cable or just use with VGA as is.  (resolution is same)  OBTW .. I like the blue tint settings feature;  had no idea what that was, but adjusting 10% blue light reduction really does make it easier on the eyes, especially in a darker room by reducing stark white backgrounds.  (much better)  In any case;  Very Pleased with this monitor purchase.  Highly recommended.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Good Picture Quality....out the box. No adjustment needed.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 19, 2021
text: This has good picture quality. The colors are bright, clear and sharp from the manufacturer. I didn't need to adjust anything.  This can be mounted on the wall or used with the included stand. All the hardware is included for mounting or screwing in the base. The included a good quality full size Philips screwdriver.I like the size. It's a big screen screen compared to what I had. It's bigger in both height and width. I've had other screens that were this size, but more wider and less height.  It looks like a TV screen. It's very lightweight. We bought this because we have several of their TV's and have had them for years.  They sell good quality  inexpensive TV's  with good picture quality that hold up well. so I decided to try their monitor when my old one suddenly died.  I didn't know they sold computer monitors.  In the past, I've always bought HP or Dell monitors.  I'm pleased.One thing I really like.....the screen resolution can be kept at optimal settings, but there is an option to make the text bigger.....like on a cell phone.  The text can be made a little or a lot bigger.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Beautiful, Low Cost monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 28, 2022
text: I needed a monitor to go with my replacement Dell workstation and decided upon this 24" model.  Decision was based mostly upon the success and beauty of the smaller 20" model I bought recently to support my Camera Security system.  I love the 20" model so much that this larger 24" was a no-brainer, especially for the price!Beautiful screen and resolution.  Supports HDMI which also includes audio for the built-in speakers.Super easy to take out of package and install in a couple of minutes.One thing I do not like about the Sceptre series is the Volume control buttons on the right-hand rear of the units.  It's a bit clunky, but certainly not a deal breaker.  Besides, I hooked up my external speakers with subwoofer to the audio out jack of my PC and the keyboard has volume control on it so this is now a non-issue.Great price and beauty.  Def recommend!

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Rare Review
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 20, 2022
text: I rarely write reviews but I thought this monitor warranted a review; it is that good. Arrived in a timely manner, packaging was great, set-up a breeze. Whenever I open a box and see "hardware" I immediately drop a swear word or two. I did in this case as well but the step-by-step instructions were crystal clear and they even include a small screwdriver with magnetic tip - who does that?! It was so easy! I was thinking "I really need to write a review for this thing". And the icing on the cake was the card they include with CS phone number and website for support. Not hidden on the bottom of an owner's manual but a separate card that called out their support resources. (not that you'd need them; it's that easy to set up) That sealed the deal. Oh, and the quality of the monitor is outstanding as well. I highly recommended this entire thing - perfection!

title: Amazing Clarity, Nice Quality
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 1, 2022
text: This is an amazing monitor for the price. I always bought Dell monitors and never tried anything else. I bought this on Prime Day and I love this thing.The picture quality is amazing. The most amazing thing that I like about it is it has built in speaker. So if I am connected via HDMI from my PC, it can relay the sound which saves the space on my desk. I use a Beelink Mini PC which doesn't have a speaker built in.Also if your PC doesn't have a port for the audio jack, you can connect your PC and this monitor via HDMI and connect the speaker audio jack to this monitor because it had audio out.This monitor has 2 HDMI inputs and 1 VGA input. It also has an audio out to which you can connect a 3.5mm Aux.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: I like this monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
text: I bought this monitor for two purposes.  Because of COVID-19, I am mostly working from home and have a work laptop.  I am using this monitor as a 2nd monitor on the laptop.  At the end of my work day, I switch the monitor over to my personal desktop as the #3 monitor on that computer.  Each computer is using a separate HDMI input on the monitor.  One of the things that I like about this monitor is that it is very light weight and has a very small border around the screen.  Both of these are nice when using multiple monitors.My only complain is that the buttons to change inputs are on the back rather that the side or bottom (or better yet, the front).  This makes it a little harder to reach the buttons in a multiple monitor setup (not at all an issue if only using one monitor).

title: Excellent, with one caveat

options: Style: 24" 75Hz Blue Light Shift | Pattern: Monitor
text: This monitor was well package, has a great HDMI picture, with 75hz refresh (so less flicker on faster moving objects, like gaming). It even comes with a nice rubber handled Phillips screwdriver for assembly, that you'll want to keep. Now for the caveat... the controls are located in the back, on the lower right, so GOOD LUCK on reaching behind and figuring out what button does what (hint: on/off is the bottom button). So if you can live with that little flaw, you'll have yourself a nice monitor.

title: A budget monitor with excellent picture quality
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2022
text: Works great, no dead pixels.  This is a budget-priced monitor, with bright, high-contrast picture quality for everyday use.  Videos are smooth and crispy-clear.  I am not a gamer, so I can't rate super-speed performance on games.  You don't get angle or height adjustment, but you can always use a riser and still save a bundle of money over other monitors.

product_name: Sceptre 24" Professional Thin 75Hz 1080p LED Monitor 2x HDMI VGA Build-in Speakers, Machine Black (E248W-19203R Series)
title: Works good but speakers aren't great, but not terrible.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2022
text: Nice prompt delivery, well packaged.  Picture is good.  The tweaking selections are all on the back which makes it  hard to adjust since you can't see both sides at once, but if you get it figured out, finally, there are no complaints, but I wish it had a front bar or screen for that.  I think I could then really tweak it well.  Speakers are okay, again they face backwards instead of out the front where I am, and my computer speakers are better,  and there is no way to switch them or add stereo, which I could do if the setting was there for it.  But I could do headphones if I wanted that.  But for the money it's not a bad deal at all.  I got the 24 inch.  I desperately needed a bigger screen and this helped me out!  The color is good for my artwork.  I did have to call tech support for a question and they were very nice and helpful.  Not a super-perfect product but a really good one, and a great deal for the price.  Thanks!

title: Best Budget Monitor I've Used!

text: I bought this as a budget option to replace an aging 19" Dell monitor that was starting to discolor and ghost, and I couldn't be happier! It's not an IPS panel, but it makes up for that with brightness and response time. The built-in speakers are a bit tinny, but they're more than acceptable if you're on a budget and not a major audiophile. I've spend upward of 400 hours gaming and doing light CAD work on this monitor with no noticeable eye strain. If you're on a budget, I would whole heartedly recommend this and other Spectre monitors as a worthwhile alternative!

title: Best Bang for your Buck!

text: I have two of these monitors that I actually use in a dual monitor setup for my office. I haven't tried gaming on it, with the exception of my kids playing Sims. I will say I like that I can have my office computer and my gaming computer connected to these monitors at the same time, without having to unplug anything. The monitors recognize when a device is connected and turned on, and will automatically load using the ports of the device that is turned on. They have good picture quality, but mediocre sound quality. If you're using the monitor for gaming, highly recommend using a headset. For work purposes, they work fine and I can hear individuals clearly on calls.
